values:
Rose's post has inpired me to (in a very loose sense) open up my music collection, and dig out my small collection of cover versions. Now, i'm not going to bung up everything i have, but here is a small selection. They'l all be either MP3 or WMA, so i hope that's not a problem.

Bowling For Soup - Baby One More Time
The Texan pop-punkers version of the Britney Spears hit, i think it was on the Freaky Friday soundtrack (the one with Linsday Lohan, not the Jodie Foster one).

Weird Al Yankovic - Angry White Boy Polka
Now, this isn't exactly a cover version - it's a medley. There's parts of songs from loads of different bands, and the trick is to name the lyrics to the song. It's pretty good, and Weird Al is a master at the musical parody.

Arctic Monkeys - Love Machine
This is ripped from a Jo Whiley Radio 1 performance, and of course covers the Girls Aloud track - they made a damn good go of it, even though they almost lose it mid way through :P

Elliott Smith - Jealous Guy
I love this song. It's another live recording and Elliott is probably one of the few people who can do this song justice. A great cover, from an outstanding musician, take from us way too early.

Me First & The Gimme Gimmes - Heart Of Glass
These are a fantastic band Essentially all they do is ska/punk versions of classic songs, and this is a good one. There's plenty more somewhere too.

Bowling For Soup - Summer Of '69
Another song by the Texan four piece, this time covering Bryan Adams. Ripped from the album "Lets Do It For Johnny!".

My Chemical Romance - All I Want For Christmas Is You
An Unliely cover version, this. MCR take the Mariah Carey chistmas hit, and give it their full on treatment. Fantastic to rock out to *makes devil horns* :P

Biffy Clyro - Take Me Out
ANother song from Jo Whiley's Radio 1 show, this time it's Biffy taking the Franz Ferdinand song, and making it sound even better, in my opinion.

Iron and Wine - Such Great Heights
I love this song to bits. An obscure cover version, this. The original was done by The Postal Service. Iron and Wine have managed to make it sound like an entirely completely different song, using only the 2 voices, and two acoustic guitars. It featured on a tv advert recently too. A really good relaxing song

Radiohead - Wish You Were Here
Not specifically Radiohead this, it's by a band called Sparklehorse, and features Thom Yorke on backing vocals. Much slower than the original by Pink Floyd, but still awesome.


All of these are on YouSendIt, so if your computer doesn't like it, then comment and i'll upload it to a different server. Similarly, if any are wrong/have expired, then i'll happily re-upload.

I was scarily hyperactive last night at work.
I can't seem to put my finger on the cause...well, actually, that's a lie. I think i do kno the reason, but i'm unsure as to wether it's possible or not.

Aaannnyway...i'm calmer now, but still very thoughtful, about many things. Half term seems to be something on my mind too - my parents want me to work a hell of a lot over that time, but i also want to take the time to actually enjoy myself once in a while - the last time i enjoyed myseflwas the last time i met up with Ellen, so that's a couple of weeks now...Ashlee and Caz want me to go out for a drink with them, which sounds fun, and Henman and Tim are back from Uni, which means spending time with them and attempting to recapture the memories of a couple of years ago...damnit, i'll get nostalgic now...

anyway...me thinks a shower, then either watch a DVD, or maybe crack on with some work...i think i know which one is more likely....

Right...my film coursework.

As some of you have seen (and thankyou for the feedback) iv'e done a review of 'The Wicker Man'. Now: i believe i've got to do one more, then a feature article..but which film to do??

The shortlist is as follows:

Psycho
Se7en
The Shining
City Of God.

I can't choose, so i'm throwing it open to the lovely peoples!

01. where/how did we meet?
02. did you like me right away?
03. take a stab at my middle name.
04. where do i live?
05. how long have you known me?
06. my age:
07. what's my birth date?
08. have you ever had a crush on me?
09. do you remember the first things i said to you?
10. what is the best feature about me?
11. what is the worst feature about me?
12. am i shy or outgoing?
13. would you say i'm funny?
14. how often do you think of me?
15. if there were one good nickname for me, what would it be?
16. have you ever told me that you love me?
17. are we good friends?
18. do you wish we were closer?
19. what would you change about me?
20. do you think you'll know me in five years?

Right, for my Film coursework, ive got to do some film journalism - the only problem is...i don't know what film/s to review/write about/waste time over.

So...

Feel free to put down any films, they can be one's you've seen, ones you haven't, your favourite one,your worst one...any!!

I'll see if i've seen it, and decide if i fancy reviewing it...if i haven't sene it, its a good excuse to go and rent it :P

(yes, i'm an indecisive bastard, sue me :P)

I'm trying to work many a thing out...

one of these is Evanscence. No-one likes them, but why? i'm listening to them now (as i have been all day, it seems), and i can't see the problem.

And Amy Lee is my idea of heaven too, but that's a different story....

grr..work ,boring

grr..coursework...boring...still not done...

grr...made a COMPLETE arse of myself last night...it involved a series of messages, and a lot of alcohol. I should have listened to Ellen...drink didn't make it better, in fact, i think it made it a lot worse...but time will tell.

In the year 2005 I resolve to:
Make the FBIs most wanted list.

Get your resolution here

Sorrow You shed tears of sorrow. It seems wherever you go
and whatever you do you end up in pain. Your
emotions are terribly weak and break easy. You
cry the easiest in turn. Everyday and night you
sit alone and weep aching for death.

What type of tears do you shed? (Girl or Guy with pix)

*blows up baloon*

*lets go*

*watches it*

*considers the similarities*

*switches off light*

THe song night was fun last night...as i expected. we were all there, that's Me, Lou, Darren, Charlotte, Dan, Martin, Becky, Ian, Mum, Alan, and Mary (the adults). And guess who was the most drunk? yup...the parents.

For some reason, they felt it necessary to embarass EVERYONE there...not just me and Lou, but Darren and Becky too, only Martin and Dan got away with it as theire parents werent there.

damn them.

Anyway, they're off to see Ron, so they'll be gone a few hours....i feel really bad now, as i said i couldnt go, as i had work to do, which is true, as my film needs doing...but it may be the last time i see him...bloody hope not....god it's worrying me.

anyway....

I'm looking forward to it.

Charlotte's (Darren's wee sis) has her birthday today, and to celebrate, load sof people are going round there for a song night....no, not Kareoke...i've heard martin sing, its not good. It's more of a 'Name that tune' type of thing, where we have to guess it from the fist few seconds. It's going to be good, as all the songs are from the 60's, 70's and 80's...so it'll show up my sister, who knows scrot all about older music!

So far, i beleive it's me, Lou, Becky, Charlotte, Darren, Dan, and Martin, along with my parents, and Darren's parents too...must swot up a bit before then....meh, i'll be ok. i kow my stuff...i think...

It's a strange time, with Crimbo gone for another year, and new year's on the horizon, so it's almost as though the world is in limbo....this also means that, work attempts to return to normailty, but fails like George W Bush attempting a sentence.

Now, the thing that amuses me is, Lee soemtimes gets uber annoyed with me, and most of the time, with good reason, as i can be an arsehole. Yet, he still insists on calling me up for a favour, and annoyingly, i almost always give in!....never been able to put my finger on it.

It was ok though, the fact that it was a 4-8 shift meant that my body clock was thrown out, and i was forever 2 hours ahead of everyone else, but screw it. I had a good laugh, and seeing Rob again made me fele better, and the look on Bethan's face...heh.

Now, i'm a bit bored, so my REd Dwarf DVD is calling me, and so is my bed....so that's a good combo...probably won't sleep either, so you may see me back. Poor you.

EDIT: i almost forgot...i bumped into Georgie yesterday too  (Piercingslut on my friends list), which was really cool, as 'ive not sene her in AGES. Met her boyfriend Jamie too, and he seems a good enough bloke. Should be fun on sunday, she's coming to see me, and Ashlee's working too...and they hate each other. So expect fireworks. She may try to get her job back there too!! If it happens, that'll be soooo good. Wasn't as much fun without her.

As the season is nearing it's end, i've decided that it's time to possibly get to work on all the things i need to do, which i mentioned a while ago....

There's a fatal flaw.

I don't have the apathy to do it.

I've the rest of the Film essay to do, and my UCAS to transfer over, and i really should email Julia to....

I'll do it...just need some motivation.

As I probably won't be here for the next couple of days:

HAPPY CHRISTMAS!!!!

I hope you all get what you want, and enjoy the day!!

I'll be around for a poke, if anyone wants to via my mobile telecommunications device!

Two days remaining...all presents wrapped up and safely (or as well as possible) from the prying eyes of the fellow sibling.

I'm slowly (and it is slow) getting into the festive spirit, though i still feel that this year, there is something missing. i don't know what, andif i knew, i'd put it right...neh, hopefully it'll sort itself out.

I'm not really looking forward to Boxing Day, as me and Lou have agreed to go to see Dad. Now, this could be a good time, as we can finally do some catching up, as we haven't seen each other since last christmas, but also i think he'll be talking about moving, and i'm not sure how to cope with that. I'm either going to be really upset and reclusive, or really pissed off and open about it. meh...I'll cross that bridge when i come to it...

So, with Christmas on us, and new Year just around the corner....

TELL ME, IF ANY, WHAT RESOLUTIONS YOU'RE GOING TO MAKE!!!

I'm going to:Learn to drive
             Stop being so pedantic
             Stop biting my nails
             Make sure all college work is done FIRST.

Now tell me...go on!!

....and thinking about things, i've made myself unhappy again.

bollocks.

Ah...Thanks to the good Mr Selby, i now don'y have to return to Sainsbury's for work purposes until the 2nd January!! muchos relaxing from now on...try to sort out this wee head of mine...answer some questions. Also, with a bit of luck, try to sort out all college stuffs. I've decided tha tinstead of the English coursework, i'm not going to do that, and instead, i'm going to take the exam in June/July time.

Meh.

Work? well...boring, really...spoke to Nat a fair bit, as she's depressed about this whole saga with Her, Adam and Kate (very confusing), and she needs someone to talk to. I don'tthink she has many people she can trust, which is something we both share, so maybe we can both use this and bounce our problems off each other.


Also: this is where YOU lot come in...wrapping presents...now, i'm notoriously bad at this, so, is there any ways/tricks to make it easier, or just take it to a shop ,and be a lazy bugger??
I've just downloaded the 'Fraggle Rock' opening sequence....gah. boredom has reared it's ugly head.

Film was ok today..except for Lee's awful jokes...i mean, they were really bad..

We say "All About My Mother", whch is by Pedro Almodovar...check IMBD if you want to know more, it's good, all about transvestites, bereavement, and stage shows...slightly odd, but good.

Anyway...to sort out the site....

It's still not working...apparently the thing is too long, or something.... ill try later

I have college soon, which will be fun-taculer (allegedly), though i'm not sure.

Its also plugging time.. http://saltnvinegar.proboards25.com/index.cgi  it was Jim's (JoeyRamone off VR)'s site, but he's given control to me, so feel free to join, and as i'm sorting it out, there may be modships available!

my computer seems to like screwing up, so ill do that long survey thing from Phil's journal that i finished....shitty thing. ill do it tomorrow.

ill also update properly tomorrow, so until then, feel free to annoy me by phone, and if you cant, well....

meh...work was good last night, but...oh, i dont know....it's probably nothing.

Screw it, it's going in my other journal for now. Sorry!

ahem. It's early for a friday...it's also cold, which is pretty good. I like the cold, the crisp feeling of the frost under your feet as you make your way to whichever destination you try to get to..ahh, and not long until crimbo either. Which remnds me, i nedd to do some crimbo shopping, but, what to get for the family that doesnt tell me what they want? I may pop into Horsham next saturdat, so Ellen, if you fancy meeting up, let me know! i'm not certain as to wether i will, but there's a good chance, unless something else coms up, but i'll cancel. Anyway...there's something i should be doing, but for the life of me, i can't remember what... Oh, i'm also back at work tonight...woo-bloody-hoo.

What a bitch!!

Well, it turns out that Jim wasn't dead, though he was in hospital for a couple of days, and it was an ex-girlfriend apparently getting 'payback', or a practical joke, or something along those lines. The thing is, why??? why mess not with his own feeling, but also with everyone on VR, people you DONT KNOW, just for a bit of fun?! man, there are some sick fucks about...

Anyway...quiet day i think today, though Crti. Thinking was fun...there was a seemingly worrying amount of solvent abuse by some exchange students in the class...hmm...best keep the marker pens away from them in future. Though it did coin a few memorable terms...."Mitch...you Bitch" being one (as she's italian, and struggles with english, she emphasises the 'i' too much, and it sounds like a rabbit being strangled). heh, and also her having a worrying obsession with Chloe's chest...heh

Anyhoo...i'm not at work until Friday, which is good, as it means ive had a week off from there, which i needed, and i dont have to worry about dashing for the train tomorrow after English. woot to that.

Well...college now  i suppose, as i'm pretty much back to full health. i went yesterday, though it was pointless, but today should be a bit more fun...or at least. 

I hope it is. It is an excuse to argue, of course :)

Jim Edwards R.I.P

Thats such a shock...i never thought that life could be so cruel as to take someone's life away so young... For those who still don't know, Jim (Joeyramone on VR) was struck by a car and killed on monday on his way home from school. He was only 15.

Its completely screwed, it really is.. I got to know him on Smerkers (his own forum he started) as i was one of the mods, so we got to talk, albeit over the posts and through PM, but  i kinda got to know him a bit. I feel worst though for his family and close friends, i cant even begin to imagine what they are going through. I know its only someone from a website, but as it's VR, and its almost like a little family on there, it makes it quite upsetting in a certain way, as i care about everyone that goes on there, and i wouldnt wish anything like that on anyone.

so, ill stop, and leave how i started.

Jim Edwards R.I.P
Very boring in film...Only Me, Vic and Anna are in the open access...and i can't be bothered to do anything at all.

Why, why,WHY haven't they sorted out our broadbnd yet??

10 days they said...and its past that now...gah, first they feck up and add the wrong phone line, then they take their time with this!....bloody idiots.

This coursework is boring, and i'm slowly running out of time. Ok, it doesn't have to be n tomorrow, but Ellen ( not you, m'dear!) wants to see how far we have got with it, and....well...er...i'm not as far as i'd like.

Oh well....
This coursework is really tiresome. but, it has to be done.

My life is rated R.
What is your life rated?
yup, understandable.

I'm feeling a bit better today, though still feeling a bit crappy....so, i thought i'll try to sum up my last few days, before i try to get some college work done....

Wednesday: crit. Thinking was ok, if not a bit boring, though we had a laugh trying to make yet another brainstorm for reasons for yet another moral problem, though i forget what exactly it was. Work was fun, though again, i didnt really have much entheusiasm for the task, heavens knows why, but me and mark had a laugh, as we were the most experienced ones there, so we had the responsability to ensure things went smoothly.

Thursday: Full day at college, which was dissected by an outing to the local drinking establishment. Twas only me, Meg and Anna, but it was a nice intimate occasion, and we took it in turns to explain our problems (well, Anna did, i don't like talking about mine too often), as she is having problems with her boyfriend, and his friends. Its all very complicated, and i really dont fancy explaining it in detail now, as i cant be bothered.
Work was...well...interesting. Me and Ashlee are seemingly getting closer, and she follows me about a lot, and wants a lot of hugs too, which is something that i'm not going to whinge about. I do wonder, however, if she is completely true...by this i mean, she recently was, erm, "rejected" as it were. By this i mean that a fellow she was interested in decided to court her friend, so she was upset, though this was a few months ago. is there a chance she might be using me to show that she can still obtain a relationship? or is this just my subconcious playing tricks one more?

Friday: the day began the same as all the others did, me waking up all too early for my liking. So the rest of the day was spent watching films that i needed to ,and other priceless gems of my collection (well, Have i Got News For You counts, right?)
Until the evening, which basically, i have enjoyed better outings. The place: Smith and Western in Chichester. What went wrong? well...lets begin, shall we? 1, We (or in the realest terms, Greg) invited Nadine, as she had returned from uni, and we (greg) wanted to catch up. Now, myself, Henman and Dani ( the other parties involved), didnt really leave on that good temrs with her the last time we spoke, so we were rather unsure of the outcome. All i must say is that she is...well...high maintenance. She seems to want to be in the centre of the attention, or the one who is in control of the conversation. Which, unfortunately, rubs off somewhat. Still, everyone has their faults, and its how it goes. The second problem: we had the table booked for 9pm. a bit late, but thats ok. But, they were running late, so we weren't seated until half past 9, and we didnt get our food until about 10pm. By that time, we were hungry, and slightly annoyed though they did give us a complimentary drink each as an apology, which was good.

Unfortunately, at about half 3 the next morning, my body decided to give me a complimentary bout of gastroenteritis. Thanks...what i really wanted.
Annoyingly, i had a national Under 25' match the following morning, and i wasnt going to pull out, as my opponent made the journey from the isle of Wight, so i made the choice to play, and fortunately, i won, as paul wasn't playing all that well, so i have the regional semi to arrange in the near future.

So far today, i had a County match at Denton island, which,didnt go our way, as the squad was left threadbare by withdrawls. so, we were well and truly hammered. still, we werent really expecting to win.

For the rest of the week...i've taken the next few days off work, and ill decide tomorrw as to wether ill go to college, as i'm not sure as to how i feel. At the moment,  i seem to be going through hot and cold phases, I'm hot at the moment, for your information.

I've got a lot to update on, as ive not bene here for a while, but at this present time, i have food poisoning.

I think it was from the Salmon dish i had at Smith and Western last night. Greg's in a similar way, but he had something else.

So now, i'm tired, i feel REALY crappy, and i think ill go to bed.

soo...tired...right. I'm going to bed EARLY tonight. i went to bed early-ish last night, but i ended up listening to music until about 2 ish...so im still tired. oh well.

Anyway, today i get to speak to Claire and see if the statement is good enough ( i think it should be), then work tonight...

tomorrow....college, possibly dissected by a trip to the pub for lunch, then work again in the evening...

So, judging by that, i should make a aapearance on friday...though that depends on how much work Ian has to do.

So, until then...have a good few days, y'all!!

Oooh...Must get the cd's done for Bev, and for Chloe...the mad woman she is...

Hmph.."my" statement is 2 lines too long at the moment, so i'm in the throws of trying to cut it down..but without success...damnit

ollege was boring, had to sit through a film entitled "One day in September", all about the 1972 Munich Olympics, where some of the Israeli team were taken hostage by palestinians. It was ok, but i was really tired, so i wasnt really following it.

Also, there's a crazy idea at work that the managers have come up with: for all us evening workers to finish not at the designated 10pm finishing time...but at midnight. So, they know where to put that idea. As i believe they will have to change our contracts, and no-one wants to do this, so no one is going to agree with it. So, if they actually go throufgh with it, all of us are walking out, as for 99% of us, we have to be up for college the next day (wel...not EVERY day), and the rest have to be up for work, so its just not feasible.

So, if i end up without a job...then, you know whats gonr wrong....

So...tired..meh...

must learn to try to go to bed earlier, or at least sleep in longer.

Me mum's off ill at the moment, as she's caught the flu-type bug thats going around. Not nice, so, she's tucked up in bed, and as me and Lou are off this morning, we can try to make her feel better...hope it works...

...and i have tonight off work, so i may try to see if anyone wants to go to the cinema, as i want to see 'Bad Santa'. If not, then ill try to get some more of my coursework done, as i'm up to the Methodology in my English, but not quite that fat on my Film...gah...ill do that i think.

How did we lose it??

How?

We're out of the double rinks...and i'm gutted, although i didnt play. We REALLY wanted to win this..we had such a good chance. At one point, We were 13 up at home, but about 12 down away (Tony was struggling at Egham all the time), but Stoney was playing really badly, and as it's his home rink, i was really surprised. I mean, we put Stoney, Stuart (used to be the U25' Singles champ), and Kevin (he IS the U25' singles champ) together on their home rink, with Darren, and hope they can thrash them, and let Tony, Matt. Gareth and Aaron keep it tight away. The turning point was the 18th end, we had lost a few ends before, and they (Surrey, this is) had taken the lead overall, but we were holding 6 on the end, and their skip (who had a shit game) drew within an inch (may not sound hard, but is when you are 25 metres away from something the 3/4 the size of a tennis ball) of the jack, to turn the score to them, and we just didnt have an answer...

Now we have to see if we can so it outdoors, as i'm going to play (instead of opting out, like i did this year), and i know Alf will be pissed off, but sod it...

Anyway, apart from that, there's nothing new to report...still trying to sort out UCAS, and my coursework (which, i hasten to add, ive actually, started now, oh the joy), and that's worrying, as the deadline for both is runnig out fast. Anyone else found it hard choosing where to go??

Oh well, ill try to do the coursework, i suppose. Inspiration will show its beautiful head soon.
